title: Use #ext4 - they say. Data will be safe, they say.... - Random stuff - Fedia
text:
[stefano],Use
[#ext4]- they say. Data will be safe, they say.[425045.666415] EXT4-fs error (device dm-2): htree_dirblock_to_tree:987: inode
[#9534852]: block 38282106: comm borg: bad entry in directory: rec_len is smaller than minimal - offset=0, inode=0, rec_len=0, name_len=0, size=4096
[oxyhyxo],
[@stefano]I've had a lot more luck with XFS and before that ReiserFS
[stefano]OP ,
[@oxyhyxo]I lost data with XFS. No data loss with ReiserFS, but I didn't manage many servers at that time.
[sanity],
[stefano]OP ,
[@sanity][@oxyhyxo]I'm using it for non-critical stuff like backups. I've lost data with btrfs - the last time it's been after a normal reboot.
[oxyhyxo],
[@stefano][@sanity]I actually prefer XFS over BTRFS. I've had a few BTRFS boxes not survive reboots. XFS generally works (at least for me)
[oxyhyxo],
[@stefano]I got pretty lucky with XFS - I could generally get the boxes back online remotely but with EXT2/3/4 would get stuck is boot fsck purgatory and require an onsite visit.ZFS changed my life :freebsd_logo:
[stefano]OP ,
[@oxyhyxo]ZFS is great :runbsd: :freebsd:
